results.title: Statins Improve Clinical Outcome After Non-aneurysmal Subarachnoid Hemorrhage: A Translational Insight From a Systematic Review of Experimental Studies
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patient@@@ characteristics such as statin-treatment (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 40 mg/d), the occurrence of @DISEASE_Vasospasm_Intracranial @DISEASE_MESH:D020301 @@@cerebral vasospasm@@@ (@DISEASE_Vasospasm_Intracranial @DISEASE_MESH:D020301 @@@CVS@@@), delayed @DISEASE_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarction@@@ (@DISEASE_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@DI@@@), delayed @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@cerebral ischemia@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@DCI@@@), and clinical outcome were recorded.

results.title: Effect of Statin Treatment in Patients with Aneurysmal Subarachnoid Hemorrhage: A Network Meta-Analysis.
results.text_hl: Comparisons across treatment durations suggested that short-term (RR 0.62, 95% CI 0.50-0.76) statin therapy reduced risk of @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@DCI@@@. CONCLUSIONS: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ 80 mg might be the most effective intervention in reducing @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@DCI@@@.

citations.NLM: Wang X, Gan Q, You C, Ma L. Effect of Statin Treatment in Patients with Aneurysmal Subarachnoid Hemorrhage: A Network Meta-Analysis. Neurocrit Care. 2024 Apr 2;():. PMID: 38565835

results.title: Simvastatin protects against intestinal ischemia/reperfusion-induced pulmonary artery dysfunction.
results.text_hl: Therefore, acute @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ administration could be therapeutic for @DISEASE_Vascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D014652 @@@pulmonary vascular disease@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ suffering from intestinal @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@ events.

results.title: Simvastatin protects ischemic spinal cord injury from cell death and cytotoxicity through decreasing oxidative stress: in vitro primary cultured rat spinal cord model under oxygen and glucose deprivation-reoxygenation conditions
results.text_hl: As yet, the underlying mechanism has not been fully studied. In models of @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@cerebral ischemia@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ attenuated @DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@neuronal death@@@ by reducing the production and @DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@toxicity@@@ of oxidative stress-related markers.

results.title: Effects of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme A reductase inhibitors on mitochondrial respiration in ischemic rat hearts.
results.text_hl: The aim of the present study was to examine the effects of @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_25675 @@@3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme A (HMG-CoA) reductase@@@ inhibitors on mitochondrial respiration in @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@ rat hearts, and to compare the effects between water-soluble @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@-soluble @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.
